p: According to Table 2, an obvious difference in the mean mortality percentage of all tested storage insect pests was detected, as essential oil concentration and exposure time were increased. For example, 25.00% mortality of O. surinamensis adults was observed at 4.71 µL/L and 24-h exposure time, which had increased to 80.00% and 100% at 14.71 µL/L after 24 and 72 h, respectively. It is apparent that the essential oil of S. intermedia gave at least 90% mortality against all tested stored-product insect pests at 58.82 µL/L after 72 h ( Table 2).
